headline: Oatmeal Energy Balls
description: Oats, peanut butter, honey, and raisins are rolled into little energy balls perfect for on-the-go snacking.
name: Oatmeal Energy Balls

recipeInstructions.text: Mix oats, peanut butter, raisins, and honey together with a fork in a bowl. Knead mixture by hand until fully incorporated; roll into 1-inch balls. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: Very Nummy!
I added 2 scoops of protein powder and it was great
I liked it! I sub honey for maple syrup..I know, but I didn't have honey lol
This was okay, I used almond butter, agave, and chocolate shavings. I’ll try to grind the oats just a little and get smoother almond butter next time.

This was the recipe I chose for a Granna and granddaughter treat. Easy enough for her to measure out, put on gloves, and mix up. I used the cookie scoop, and she rolled the dough into balls. Tasty too! We did add mini chocolate chips instead of the raisins since neither she nor her brother cares for raisins.
I used crasins and dried blueberries instead of raisins, it’s better. Also it’s very peanut-buttery.
Qqq’

Meh. OK, but not great in my opinion. I might make them again just because they are so easy. Probably better for hiking or around the house than taking to friends. They're a little lackluster. Good basic concept though
Awesome, easy and fun snack to make with the kids!!
This recipe is delicious and so easy. I made it with chocolate chips and it was a huge hit!

I made these with dried cranberries instead of raisins and they were delicious! Also made them with mini chocolate chips which were really good. Just made my second batch last night. Hoping to use these for nutrition on my longer runs. Very peanut buttery so perfect for me!

I used some chopped dates and raisins. Also a tsp of flax seeds and 2 tbs of sesame seeds. Rolled them in ground pecans that I toasted first. They are in the fridge but the one I tasted was really good. Thanks
Loved this recipe healthy simple and quick! Unfortunately didn’t find any raisins so I’ve substitute the ingredient with dates and it turned out just perfect ! thank u for the great recipe
I'm always looking for food of all types to make myself so I can stay away from all the preservatives in store bought ready-made foods. These are every bit as good as any snack we've had. Thanks
Only used oats, dried cranberries, and with the pb, I cooked with an equal amount of vanilla rice milk (on low), until nice and creamy....the best! Nice protein snack!
Perfect. I've made this recipe a few times, substituting the raisins for dried blueberries or chocolate chips. Always delicious

Yum!!!! These were great I would recommend adding 1/4 a teaspoon of vanilla and I put some in the fridge and cooked som they both tasted great! Thanks for sharing this dirtydave. Great recipe thums up. 

By cookiecookie follow me!
Easy and delicious. A great easy to carry snack before swim practice or school. My children love them and they are better than the expensive energy bars.
I didn't add raisins since I didn't have any, but this was amazing and really easy to make!

Everyone in my family loved these! I didn't know something so simple could taste so good! We put them on a cookie sheet and put it in the freezer. Great little tasty bites - feels like a forbidden treat, but they're not! Will definitely make these again :) Thanks, DirtyDave!
These are really good! It is my favorite recipe!!! ---Aiden 8 yrs. old

Very easy and so yummy. I love this recipe because you don't need any special ingredient so you can throw it together with whatever you have in your cupboards. I added dried cranberries and chocolate chips.

A quick batch of 16 takes 2C of oats and 1C of peanut butter, plus 3 ish Tblsp on honey and whatever other toppings you want - I've used chocolate chips, cranberries and sunflower seeds. Such a great thing to eat before a busy day or to give to friends who need a boost!
This recipe was very tasty, but I felt it lacked a little something. I dipped the balls in powdered sugar, and they were delicious! My children enjoyed making them with me; the recipe is very simple.
It was so easy to make. My very picky 2 year old loves them, and she doesn't like much!
These turned out wonderful! They held together nicely and make the perfect on the go snack for me!!!
This is a quick and easy recipe! It is perfect for a healthy grab and go snack!!!
My son has a severe peanut allergy, so I substituted Wowbutter (a soy based peanut butter substitued) and it was still very good! So it can even be tweaked a little for people with allergies!
Added a sprinkle of cinnamon. Yum!
Uh, may as well just get a spoon and eat the peanut butter from the jar. I kept adding raisins, honey, and oats until I could taste them. Won't make this again, but I'm not throwing them out either.
Love this. Both my kiddos sometimes won't eat. These are the perfect substitute anytime.
great for my 5 1/2 year old who doesn't like to sit still for breakfast. She's a 'grazer' and this gives her a good sustained level of energy throughout the day

Just made this with my 7 yr old grandson and he loved it! Super easy and he enjoyed getting his hands in it. Tastes great following the basic recipe but will try nuts, seeds and maybe choc chips in the future. Thanks for the recipe!

There are a million variations on this recipe, but this is the one to start from. It would be difficult to screw up this recipe. Add whatever you have in the cupboard (sunflower seeds, flax seeds,dried fruits, etc.) and adjust the rest of the ingredients so it's still moist enough to make a ball. I don't worry to much about spoiling, since they rarely last more than a day or two.
Simple no bake recipe! This would be easy to change by adding chia seeds, carob powder or any other "energy" ingredients!

I like that this has such simple ingredients and not a lot of sugar. It held together well and tasted good. Raisins added a nice chewy texture/taste. Good balance of oats to peanut butter. My boys are teens and only attracted to things with chocolate chips in them, but they still liked these.
